messages.message:
Hi all, I'm working on adding audit logs to Apps operations and I'm noticing that the same set of endpoints are defined for Apps CRUD operations in both `projects.py` and `aihub_build.py` . There is a `class AppView` in both files have a `/projects/apps`  endpoint. It seems `projects.py` one are prefixed with `/api/v2/zero-shot-idp` whilst the `aihub_build.py`  ones are prefixed with `/api/v2/aihub/build` . I had a few questions about this:
1. Why do we have two separate endpoints for the same Apps CRUD operations?
2. Why are some Apps functionality split between the two endpoints?
cc @Gauti

I think @andy would be the better person to answer these queries.
AFAIK, they moved out of `class AppView` of the `projects.py` and wrote in `aihub_build.py` for better URL signature and SDK convenience. But it was never fully depreciated, hence the redundancy.
the `zero-shot-idp` prefix should be deprecated at this point. that was a bad prefix that we implemented during AI Hub launch years ago
